qas.question: What themes were influenced by her acting role in Dreamgirls?
Which singer did Beyonce honor by entertaining with her song "Deja Vu"?
Who motivated Beyonce to explore other areas of music?
What movie influenced Beyonce towards empowerment themes?
How did Etta James influence her?
Where did she perform wearing Baker's hula skirt?
What singer inspired Beyoncé's B'Day album?
What song did Beyoncé sing at a 2006 concert to honor Josephine Baker?

context: The <a0_0>feminism and female empowerment<a0_0/> themes on Beyoncé's second solo album B'Day were inspired by her role in <a3_0>Dreamgirls<a3_0/> and by singer <a1_0><a6_0>Josephine Baker<a1_0/>.<a6_0/> Beyoncé paid homage to Baker by performing "<a7_0>Déjà Vu<a7_0/>" at the <a5_0>2006 Fashion Rocks concert<a5_0/> wearing Baker's trademark mini-hula skirt embellished with fake bananas. Beyoncé's third solo album I Am... Sasha Fierce was inspired by Jay Z and especially by <a2_0>Etta James<a2_0/>, whose "<a4_0>boldness<a4_0/>" inspired Beyoncé to explore other musical genres and styles. Her fourth solo album, 4, was inspired by Fela Kuti, 1990s R&B, Earth, Wind & Fire, DeBarge, Lionel Richie, Teena Marie with additional influences by The Jackson 5, New Edition, Adele, Florence and the Machine, and Prince.
